snippet: Profitable American companies enjoyed a 12.6 percent tax rate, far below the federal statutory rate, thanks to legal loopholes, according to the Government Accountability Office.
abstract: Government Accountability Office releases study showing that biggest, most profitable American companies pay only a fraction of taxes they would owe under official corporate rate; finds that legal loopholes allow large corporations to enjoy 12.6 percent tax rate, far below federal statutory rate of 35 percent.
lead_paragraph: Profitable American companies enjoyed a 12.6 percent tax rate, far below the federal statutory rate, thanks to legal loopholes, according to the Government Accountability Office.

headline.main: Big Companies Paid a Fraction of Corporate Tax Rate
headline.print_headline: Big Companies Paid a Fraction of Corporate Tax Rate
